cause.description:
"Ishimwe" means "Give Him Praise and Thanks" in Kinyarwanda, the language of Rwanda.
The inspiration and vision for the Ishimwe Center started when Faith Shaw returned to her native land of Rwanda in 2000. She was broken-hearted by the sight of countless small children living in cardboard boxes on the street and fending for themselves. Faith and her husband Roger established the first Ishimwe Center home in 2004, the N'iwacu Rescue Home at Ruhengeri. Their vision has been to provide a place in which children rescued from desperate circumstances can grow in a safe and loving environment, attend school, and have a bright future.
Please join the Ishimwe Center group on Facebook to learn about specific children who need your sponsorship: http://facebook.com/group.php?gid=2480876644

cause.mission: The aim of the Ishimwe Center is to create real and lasting hope for some of the most needy children and widows in Rwanda by the provision of family homes and by educational sponsorship programs.
cause.name: Ishimwe Center - Rescue Home for Rwandan Orphans
